children.name: a number of things as a group
set
children.definition: a group of similar things that are used together, or a group of ideas, facts etc: bộ
examples: ▪ a chess set
▪ a cutlery set
set of
▪ Amy bought him a set of tools for metal and woodworking.
▪ I gave a spare set of house keys to my neighbours.
▪ The first set of questions wasn’t too bad, but they got really difficult after that.
▪ We started the meeting by agreeing on a set of objectives.

children.name: group
children.partOfSpeech: [countable noun with singular or plural verb in British English]
children.definition: a number of separate things that are thought of as a group because they are close together or are all similar in some way: nhóm

children.name: group of nhóm các
examples: ▪ The house was hidden behind a tall group of trees.
▪ News International is a group of companies that produce newspapers and TV programmes.
▪ A group of new houses is to be built on the old playing-field.
▪ Today you will learn a new group of verbs.

children.name: collection
children.definition: a group of similar things that have been put together because they are interesting or attractive: bộ sưu tập
examples: a stamp collection
collection of
a collection of Japanese vases
an art collectionthe National Gallery’s art collection
a stamp/coin/book/glass etc collectionan impressive Roman coin collection

children.name: a
examples: CD/record/music collectionHave you seen his CD collection?

children.name: a photographic collection
examples: The museum’s photographic collection dates from the nineteenth century.

children.name: a museum collection
examples: The specimens are now part of a fine museum collection in London.

children.name: a library collection
examples: Most lecturers are keen to build up library collections in their subjects.

children.name: a private collection
children.definition: belonging to a person rather than a museum, gallery etc
examples: Many of the paintings are now in private collections.

children.name: a national collection
examples: France has many national art collections.

children.name: a permanent collection
examples: The art gallery hosts exhibitions and a permanent collection.

children.name: a large collection
children.definition: alsoan extensive collectionformal
examples: The museum has an extensive collection of Greek statues.

children.name: have a collection
examples: She has an extensive collection of Chinese vases.

children.name: start a collection
examples: I think I might start a stamp collection.

children.name: build up a collection
examples: He gradually built up a collection of plants from all over the world.

children.name: acquire/assemble/amass a collectionformal
examples: The two men amassed a remarkable collection of medieval manuscripts.

children.name: sth holds/houses a collectionformal
examples: The museum holds a comprehensive collection of photographs from that period.

children.name: a collection consists of/contains something
examples: The collection consists of some 500 items.

children.name: a collection includes something
examples: The collection includes paintings both in oils and in watercolours.

children.name: lot
children.definition: informal a group of things: đống
examples: this lot/that lot
▪ She handed me a bag of old clothes. ‘Could you take this lot to the charity shop for me?’
▪ Right lads, let’s pick up this lot and go home.
▪ Bring that lot over here, will you?

children.name: assortment
children.definition: a mixture of different things or of various kinds of the same thing: các loại

children.name: assortment of
examples: On the floor was an assortment of boxes and packages.
The soldier received a parcel containing an assortment of shirts, biscuits, and canned food.

children.name: cluster
children.definition: a small group of things of the same type that are close to each other: cụm

children.name: cluster of
examples: ▪ From the airplane we could already see little clusters of houses.
▪ It’s an attractive shrub with dark shiny leaves, that has clusters of white flowers in early June.
▪ The adult female lays large clusters of eggs.

children.name: in clusters
examples: ▪ Most galaxies are found in clusters rather than in isolation.

children.name: batch
children.definition: a group of things of the same type that are made or dealt with at the same time: lô
examples: ▪ Sort the files into batches and give one batch to each secretary.

children.name: batch of lô
examples: ▪ The baker took a batch of freshly baked rolls out of the oven.
▪ Mr Green, I have a batch of letters here for you to sign.

children.name: collection
children.definition: a group of things that someone has collected because they areattractiveorinteresting:
examples: bộ sưu tập
coin/stamp etc collection bộ sưu tập đồng xu, tem
▪ Have you seen Alvin’s stamp collection
Bạn đã xem bộ sưu tập tem của Alvin chưa?
collection of bộ sưu tập về
▪ On the shelf was his mother’s collection of crystal vases.
Trên kệ là bộ sưu tập bình pha lê của mẹ anh ta.
▪ The museum has one of the world’s finest collections of Impressionist paintings.
Bảo tàng có một trong những bộ sưu tập tranh Ấn tượng đẹp nhất thế giới.

children.name: set
children.definition: /set/  acompletecollection of one type of object:
examples: bộ
▪The head teacher was presented with a set of the Encyclopaedia Britannica, worth more than £1,600.
Người đứng đầu giáo viên đã được trình bày với một bộ Britannica Encyclopaedia, trị giá hơn 1.600 bảng Anh.
complete set nguyên bộ
▪For sale - ‘The Guitarist’ magazine - complete set, 1984-1992.
Rap bán - tạp chí 'Người đàn Guitarist' - nguyên bộ, 1984-1992.
set of bộ
▪a set of commemorative gold coins
một bộ đồng tiền vàng kỷ niệm

children.name: things
children.definition: use this when you are talking about two or more things of different types and you do not need to say what they are: đồ, thứ
examples: ▪ I threw a few things into a bag and ran to the car.
somebody’s things
spoken the things that someone owns or that they are carrying with them
▪ She’s coming back later to get her things.
all sorts/kindsof thingsa lot of different types of things mọi thứ, đủ thứ
▪ They sell furniture, toys, cards - all sorts of things.

children.name: stuff
children.definition: 1 thingsinformalused when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are:
examples: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
Where’s all the camping stuff?
2 sb’s stuffinformalthe things that belong to sb :
Did you get the rest of your stuff?
You’re not going to have a lot of time to pack up your stuff before you move.
3 activities/ideasinformalused when talking about different activities, subjects, or ideas, when you do not say exactly what these are :
What kind of stuff do you like to read?
I’ve got so much stuff to do this weekend.
There’s a lot of interesting stuff in this book.
He’s talked to me aboutall that stufftoo.
He does mountain biking and skiing, andstuff like that.

children.name: odds and ends
children.definition: several different things, especially small things that are not of much value: đồ linh tinh, đồ lặt vặt.

children.name: In the drawer she found a photograph, an old hairbrush, and various other odds and ends
examples: Odds and ends that haven’t sold have been drastically reduced in price.

children.name: bits and pieces/bits and bobsBritish
children.definition: informal a number of small objects that are all different from each other: đồ linh tinh, lặt vặt
examples: ▪ There are all sorts of bits and pieces in this box.
▪ Do any of these bits and bobs belong to you?

children.name: paraphernalia
children.definition: a large number of different things which you need for a particular activity - you can often use this humorously: đồ đạc (cho một hoạt động)
examples: The car is packed solid with all our camping paraphernalia.
She was charged with possessing drug paraphernalia.
We sell pots, gloves, seeds and other gardening paraphernalia.
Bags of cocaine and all sorts of drug paraphernalia were seized at the airport.
All the paraphernalia for making tea and coffee stood on the bedside table.
The police found drug paraphernalia all over the house.

children.name: a group of things on top of each other
heap
children.definition: a large untidy pile of things: đống
examples: a rubbish heap
heap of
There was a heap of stones where the building used to be.
in a heap
The envelopes for posting lay in a heap on her desk.
We piled the branches into heaps for burning.

children.name: pile
children.definition: 1 arrangement of things a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each otherSYN stack: chồng
examples: pile of
His mother came in carrying a pile of ironing in her arms.
Flora shuffled through a pile of magazines.
in/ into piles
The books were arranged in neat piles on her desk.
She tidied up the books and put them inneat piles.
Can you separate those out into two piles - A to L and M to Z, please?
He balanced the plateon the top of a pileof books.
2[C] a large amount of something arranged in a shape that looks like a small hill : đống
pile of
piles of melting snow
All that remained of the old house was a pile of rubble.
Sophie stooped to throw another branch on the pile.
He began tosweepthe pieces of glassintoapile.
in piles

children.name: stack
children.definition: a neat pile of things of the same type: chụm, đống
examples: The whole stack fell over, and half the plates got broken.
stack of
▪ Next to the bottles was a tall stack of plastic cups.
▪ a stack of sales brochures
a stack of papers
stacks of dirty dishes

children.name: mound
children.definition: a pile of something with a round shape: gò, mô, đống

children.name: mound of
examples: The Grand Hotel was now just a mound of rubble.
A mound of leaves is the perfect place for a hedgehog to hibernate.

children.name: a small mound of rice on the plate
mountain
children.definition: a very large pile of sth with a round shape:
examples: a mountain of dirty laundry waiting to be washed

children.name: collection
children.definition: a group of objects together in the same place: đống, chồng

children.name: a collection of empty wine bottles on the back porch
examples: There's quite a collection of toothbrushes in the bathroom.

children.name: a group of things that are tied together or fastened together
wad
children.definition: 1a number of sheets of paper, especially paper money, that are held or tied together: xấp, nùi, tập
examples: wad of
a wad of dollar bills
I saw him trying to press a wad of cash into the woman’s hand. She wouldn’t take it.
She opened her handbag, and pulled out a wad of banknotes.
2a thick soft mass of material that has been pressed together
wad of
a wad of cotton wool

children.name: bundle
children.definition: several things of the same type, for example papers, clothes, or sticks, that are fastened or tied together:
examples: bundle of
a bundle of twigs
He put his hand in his pocket, and pulled out a large bundle of £50 notes.
inbundle
She keeps all his old letters, tied up in bundles.

children.name: sheaf
children.definition: 1several pieces of paper held or tied together: thếp

children.name: sheaf of
examples: He laid a sheaf of documents on the desk.
He had a sheaf of papers under his arm.

children.name: 2a bunch of wheat, corn etc tied together after it has been cut : bó, lượm
examples: I saw her put a sheaf of notes into her briefcase.

children.name: bunch
children.definition: a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together: bó, cụm , búi, buồng

children.name: a bunch of flowers/roses/daffodils etc
examples: I picked a bunch of flowers from the garden.

children.name: a bunch of keys
examples: A bunch of keys dangled from his belt.

children.name: a bunch of grapes
examples: She served the cheese with a bunch of black grapes.

children.name: a bunch of bananas
examples: Bunches of bananas hung in the trees.

children.name: a bunch of herbs/parsley/thyme etc
examples: You might like to add a bunch of fresh herbs to the stock.

children.name: bunch of
examples: I’ll send her a bunch of flowers .

children.name: book
children.definition: a number of one type of thing fastened together flat inside a paper cover: xấp, tập
examples: a cheque book
a bookofstamps/tickets/matches

children.name: collection
children.definition: a group of people, especially people you think are strange or unusual in some way: đống

children.name: collection of
examples: There was an interesting collection of people at the wedding.

children.name: generation
children.definition: a group of products or machines which are all at the same stage of development: đời, thế hệ

children.name: anewgeneration of low-fat margarines
examples: Scientists are working on developing thenextgeneration of supercomputers.

children.name: pack
children.definition: sth wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere: gói
examples: pack of
a pack of three T-shirts
informationpack
Send away for your free information pack today.
The information pack consists of a brochure and a map.

children.name: package
children.definition: gói
examples: 1a set of ideas or services that are suggested or offered all together as a group
package of measures/proposals/incentives etc
The government has announced a package of measures to assist affected areas.
aid/financial/benefits etc package
Many banks are offering financial packages for students.
The aid package for the earthquake-hit area will include emergency food and medical supplies.
2a set of related programs sold together for use on a computer
software/word-processing/graphics etc package
The computer comes with a software package.

children.name: range
children.definition: a number of things that are all different, but are all of the same general type
examples: range of
a range of services
The drug is effective against a range of bacteria.

children.name: a wide/broad range
examples: The Institute organises talks on a wide range of topics.

children.name: a whole range
children.definition: a wide range
examples: He also supports a whole range of other charities.

children.name: a large/great/huge/vast range
examples: A vast range of plants are used in medicines.

children.name: a diverse range
examples: During his career he has run a diverse range of businesses.

children.name: a narrow/limited range
examples: They only had a very limited range of products available.

children.name: selection
children.definition: a group of things of a particular type, often of things that are for saleSYN range:
examples: selection of
a wide selection of shellfish
They only have alimited selectionof his books.

children.name: a wide/large/big selection
examples: The museum shop offers a wide selection of items.

children.name: a good selection
examples: There is a good selection of bars and cafés nearby.

children.name: a varied selection
examples: The supermarket has a varied selection of fruit juice drinks especially for children.

children.name: chain
children.definition: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person: chuỗi
examples: chain of
a chain of restaurants
hotel/restaurant/retail etc chain
several major UK supermarket chains

children.name: bracket
children.definition: a set group with fixed upper and lower limits
examples: income/tax/age etc bracketa particular income, tax etc range :
They were both surgeons in a high income bracket.
Most British university students are in the 18 - 22 age bracket.
Her pay rise brought her into a new tax bracket.

children.name: round
children.definition: a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process
examples: round of
a third round of peace talks
the Government’s latest round of expenditure cuts

children.name: a round of talks/negotiations/meetings
examples: A second round of talks got under way this week.

children.name: a round of voting
examples: In the first round of voting he took 44.5 percent of the vote,

children.name: a round of cuts
children.definition: when a government or a company reduces the size or amount of sth
examples: The President is likely to approve a new round of cuts in military forces.

children.name: a round of layoffs
children.definition: when people are told to leave their jobs
examples: The latest round of layoffs could bring its labor force down to 60,000.

children.name: a round of violence
examples: What has prompted the latest round of violence?

children.name: in one
children.definition: (all) combined in a single person or object
examples: With this model you get a radio, CD player and cassette deck all in one.

children.name: world
children.definition: 1a particular group of countries
examples: the Western/Arab etc world
the Muslim World
the highest unemployment rate in the Western world
the English-speaking world
agricultural practices inthe developing world
the economies ofthe industrialized world
the modern/industrialized world
2 the natural/animal/plant worldall of nature, or all animals or plants considered as a group :
the wonders of the natural world
